articles.title: Friendly Gathering Held
articles.content:
Friendly Gathering Held
Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Foreign Ministry arranged a friendly gathering with the staff members of the Cuban embassy here Wednesday, the 32nd anniversary of the DPRK visit by Fidel Castro Ruz.
					 Present there on invitation were Jesus De Los Angeles Aise Sotolongo, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK, and his embassy officials.
					
					 On hand were Ho Yong Bok, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and officials concerned.
					
					 The participants recalled with deep emotion the historic days when President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il had an emotion-charged meeting with Fidel Castro Ruz.
					
					 They talked about further strengthening the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation provided by the preceding leaders and being reliably inherited by respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un and Raul Castro Ruz and played sports and amusement games.

articles.title: DPRK Wins Gold Prize in Izhevsk Int'l Acrobatics Festival
articles.content:
DPRK Wins Gold Prize in Izhevsk Int'l Acrobatics Festival
Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- The physical acrobatics "Horizontal bar and flying from swing" by acrobats of the DPRK won the gold prize, the highest prize, at the 11th Izhevsk International Acrobatics Festival. 
					 The festival took place in Izhevsk City of the Republic of Udmurtiya of Russia from Mar. 7 to 11.
					
					 The festival brought together more than 200 excellent acrobats from 17 countries including the DPRK, Russia, Romania, France and Italy.

articles.title: Youth Activists in Rural Areas Visit Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Youth Activists in Rural Areas Visit Mangyongdae
Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- The participants in the national meeting of activists of rural youth workteams and sub-workteams visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 After visiting the Mangyongdae Revolutionary Museum, they went to the old home of Mangyongdae. They looked round the mementoes preserved there, recalling the revolutionary careers of the President and his family members in Mangyongdae.
					
					 They also went round the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt Taesong, the Korean Revolution Museum, the Youth Movement Museum, the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum, the Phyongchon Revolutionary Site and the Sci-Tech Complex and enjoyed a pleasant time at the Central Zoo, the Kaeson Youth Park and the Rungna People's Pleasure Park.

articles.title: Construction of Tanchon Power Station Progresses Apace
articles.content:
Construction of Tanchon Power Station Progresses Apace
Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- The first-stage project of the construction of the Tanchon Power Station progresses apace in the DPRK.
					 According to data available, its builders carried out the excavation of bedrocks for power stations No. 1 and 5 at 55 percent and tunneling of working pits at 44 percent and several units began heading the main waterway tunnel.
					
					 Soldier builders in charge of the construction of the Tanchon Power Station No. 1 have introduced rational methods to speed up the installation of conical pipe and concrete revetment of spillway, while removing over 800 cubic meters of earth everyday to lay pressure pipeline.
					
					 Soldier builders in charge of the waterway tunnel dug through more than 2,000 meters of pilot tunnel by raising the efficiency of blasting.
					
					 Those in charge of building the Sinhong Dam of the Power Station No. 5 excavate at least 500 cubic meters of bedrock everyday.
					
					 Scientists and technicians determined the destination of waterway tunnel and position of water intake in a scientific way, thus reducing the amount of bedrock excavation and concrete tamping.
					
					 And they have made contributions to hastening the tunneling by detecting the positions of working pits and danger sections with the method of topographical analysis and applying fume-removing technology, blast remote-controller, mobile meter for measuring heat of hydration and others.

articles.title: Masterpiece "Muakdo (Pictorial Dance and Music)"
articles.content:
Masterpiece "Muakdo (Pictorial Dance and Music)"
Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- The Ryangchon Temple in Kowon County, South Hamgyong Province of the DPRK is known as not only a historical cultural relic with a long history but also the one keeping precious paintings in their original states.
					 The temple was built in 753 and rebuilt in the period of the Feudal Joson Dynasty (1392-1910).
					
					 Seen on an angled ceiling of its main hall is "Muakdo (Pictorial Dance and Music)" which is appreciated as a masterpiece.
					
					 The painting shows 22 men and women dancing while playing national musical instruments.
					
					 Every visitor to the temple praises it as the masterpiece representing the ceiling pictures drawn in the period of the Feudal Joson Dynasty, fascinated by the vivid description of cheerful looks of dancers and musicians.
					
					 Its painter has been unknown, but its brushwork reminds every viewer of the one applied to the painting "Dance" by Kim Hong Do, famous painter of Korea in the 18th century.
					
					 "Muakdo" has been preserved as one of the precious art relics of the Korean nation thanks to the policy of the Workers' Party of Korea on the protection of national heritage.

articles.title: Japan Must Set Right Its Own Human Rights Issue: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Japan Must Set Right Its Own Human Rights Issue: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- Recently the Japanese newspaper Yomiuri Shimbun disclosed the fact that the number of cases of maltreatment of disabled persons is increasing in Japan and it was more than 2 500 in 2016 alone, saying that the wrongdoers were victims' family members or employees of homes for the aged and businesses.
					 The disabled people who should be protected in society are subject to discrimination and contempt in Japan, Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in a commentary.
					
					 Corrupt and ailing Japan is the tundra of human rights where all sorts of social evils and inhumane crimes prevail, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 However, human rights abuser Japan is shamelessly faulting other countries over the situation of human rights in the international arena. This is an insult to the genuine international justice and human rights.
					
					 See your own shadow, as the saying goes. It urges a man to find his own fault before detecting others'. 
					
					 If Japan foolishly continues faulting others, it would face international isolation and contempt. Japan would be well advised to reflect itself with cool head and mend its own human rights issue.

articles.title: U.S. Blasted for Ratcheting Up Sanctions and Pressure on DPRK
articles.content:
U.S. Blasted for Ratcheting Up Sanctions and Pressure on DPRK
Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- The U.S. recently announced that it would impose sanctions on 56 designations in total - 27 shipping and trading companies, 28 vessels and 1 individual - of the DPRK and other countries under the pretext of preventing its "attempt to evade the sanctions" and intercepting the illegal means to help the transactions in the open sea.
					 Commenting on the fact, Minju Joson Wednesday says that it shows how desperately the U.S. is working to ratchet up the sanctions and pressure on the DPRK and suffocate it.
					
					 The U.S. recent announcement is not merely a continuation of such anti-DPRK sanction and pressure racket, the paper notes, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. seeks to realize a cynical ploy to bring back the situation to a phase of tension by escalating the sanctions and pressure on the DPRK.
					
					 It has so far justified the hegemonic policy towards the Asia-Pacific region under the pretext of mounting tensions on the Korean Peninsula. So, it is seeking to stem the detente on the peninsula, getting the jitters about it. 
					
					 The U.S. recent announcement of additional sanctions is nothing but a red herring aimed at tarnishing the international image of the DPRK and diverting the attention of the international community welcoming the detente on the peninsula.
					
					 It is the U.S. black-hearted intention to create a phase of confrontation on the peninsula by rattling the nerves of the DPRK and plugging more countries into the sanctions racket.
					
					 Such sanctions can never be justified as they are illegal and unethical.

articles.title: Park Geun Hye Group's Plot to Suppress Demonstrators by Force Revealed
articles.content:
Park Geun Hye Group's Plot to Suppress Demonstrators by Force Revealed
Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- The Park Geun Hye group of south Korea was newly disclosed to have hatched a plot to suppress the massive candlelight demonstration by invoking the fascist "garrison order".
					 The director of the army human rights center told reporters in Seoul on March 8 that Chongwadae and the Defence Ministry pushed forward the preparations in secrecy to hurl the troops depending on the dismissal of the impeachment of Park at the "constitutional court", adding that it was part of preparations to quell by force the candlelight demonstrators by declaring the "garrison order" till Park returned to office.
					
					 The "garrison order" is similar in nature to the "martial law" but it can be invoked by the "president" without consent from the "National Assembly", he said.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Brief Biography, Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced in Hungary
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Brief Biography, Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced in Hungary
Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- The Hungarian Preparatory Committee for Celebrating the Day of the Sun posted on a website President Kim Il Sung's brief biography and respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's work "The Great Comrade Kim Il Sung Is the Eternal Leader of Our Party and Our People" on Feb. 28.
					 The work, published on April 20, Juche 101(2012), deals with the revolutionary exploits President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il performed all their life.
					
					 It also indicates the tasks for firmly defending and adding eternal luster to the ideas and feats of the great leaders.

articles.title: Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung to Be Marked in Nigeria
articles.content:
Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung to Be Marked in Nigeria
Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee of the People's Progressive Party of Nigeria for celebrating HE Generalissimo Kim Il Sung was formed in Abuja on March 7.
					 Damian Ogbonna, national chairman of the People's Progressive Party of Nigeria, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize colorful political and cultural events such as round-table talks, book exhibition and film show to praise the revolutionary career of President Kim Il Sung and introduce successes registered by the army and people of the DPRK in the struggle for building a powerful socialist nation and reunifying the country on the occasion of his birth anniversary, the Day of the Sun.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised by Russian Newspapers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised by Russian Newspapers
Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- Russian newspapers gave special write-ups under such titles as "Birth of leader Kim Jong Il and the world", "Undying exploits for peace" and "Feature of a great man" to his birth anniversary.
					 They carried portraits of smiling Kim Jong Il and his photos.
					
					 The paper Komsomolskaya Pravda said that Kim Jong Il developed in depth the Juche idea through his energetic ideo-theoretical activities and scientifically clarified the theoretical and practical matters arising in accomplishing the human cause of independence and thus provided the progressive people with the powerful ideo-theoretical weapon for building an independent and peaceful new world free from aggression and war.
					
					 The papers Serp I Molot and Moskovskii Komsomolets stressed that Kim Jong Il performed the exploits to be specially recorded in history while guiding the party, state and army and it is his greatest exploit that the DPRK has demonstrated before the world its dignity as the invincible politico-military power.
					
					 Glasnosti, Nakhodkinski Rabochi, Nizhegorodskaya Pravda, Byvor, Zavtra, Tsumenskaya Pravda, Khabarovski Express and other newspapers and the Khabarovsk territory online newspaper Zebri Deve conveyed in detail the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il, adding that Kimjongilia, immortal flower, has come into full bloom in many countries.

articles.title: Cancilleria coreana efectua encuentro de amistad con miembros de embajada cubana
articles.content:
Cancilleria coreana efectua encuentro de amistad con miembros de embajada cubana
Pyongyang, 14 de marzo (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 32o aniversario de la visita de Fidel Castro Ruz a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, la cancilleria coreana preparo el dia 14 un encuentro de amistad con los miembros de la embajada cubana en Corea.
					A la ocasion fueron invitados el embajador Jesus De Los Angeles Aise Sotolongo y otros integrantes de la sede diplomatica cubana.
					
					Se distinguian tambien el vicecanciller Ho Yong Bok y otros funcionarios del MINREX.
					
					Los participantes recordaron los dias historicos en que el Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il se reunieron con Fidel Castro Ruz.
					
					Profundizaron la amistad hablando del tema de desarrollar aun mas las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre Corea y Cuba, preparadas por los lideres antecesores de ambos paises y continuadas con firmeza por el Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un y Raul Castro Ruz, y entablando los juegos deportivos y de recreo.

articles.title: Acrobatas coreanos ganan premio de oro en festival internacional de circo
articles.content:
Acrobatas coreanos ganan premio de oro en festival internacional de circo
Pyongyang, 14 de marzo (ACNC) -- En el XI Festival Internacional de Circo de Izhevsk, fue otorgado el premio de oro, maximo galardon, a la acrobacia corporal coreana "Barra fija y vuelo en trapecio".
					El evento tuvo lugar desde el dia 7 hasta el 11 en la ciudad de Izhevsk de la Republica de Udmurtiya de la Federacion Rusa con la participacion de mas de 200 acrobatas sobresalientes de 17 paises, inclusive la RPDC, Rusia, Rumania, Francia e Italia.

articles.title: Japon debe resolver primero el problema interno de DDHH, aconseja Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Japon debe resolver primero el problema interno de DDHH, aconseja Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, 14 de marzo (ACNC) -- Recientemente, el rotativo japones Yomiuri Shimbun informo que se incrementan en su pais los casos de maltrato a los discapacitados y su numero se totalizo en mas de 2500 en el ano 2016.
					Los culpables son los familiares de victimas y los empleados de asilos de ancianos, empresas, etc.
					
					Como se ve, sufren la discriminacion y el desprecio en Japon los discapacitados que merecen la proteccion social.
					
					Al respecto, el diario Rodong Sinmun publico hoy un comentario individual que sigue:
					
					Japon es el peor violador de DDHH y la tierra infernal para los mismos donde campean los males sociales y los crimenes antieticos de toda indole.
					
					Sin embargo, el pais isla cuestiona atrevidamente la situacion de DDHH de otros paises en la arena internacional, lo cual significa una ofensa sobre la justicia internacional y los verdaderos DDHH.
					
					Si Japon sigue criticando a otros en lugar de arreglar sus defectos, sera aislado y despreciado en la palestra internacional.
					
					Le seria sensato reparar primero el problema de DDHH de casa.

articles.title: Minju Joson acusa a EE.UU. de endurecer la sancion y presion anti-RPDC
articles.content:
Minju Joson acusa a EE.UU. de endurecer la sancion y presion anti-RPDC
Pyongyang, 14 de marzo (ACNC) -- Hace poco, Estados Unidos anuncio que impondria la sancion contra 56 blancos en total, especificamente, 27 companias de transporte maritimo y de comercio exterior, 28 barcos y un individuo de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y del tercer pais, bajo el pretexto de impedir la "evasiva de sancion" de este pais socialista y controlar los medios ilegales que ayudan las transacciones en alta mar.
					Esta medida evidencia cuan desesperado esta el imperio americano para asfixiar a la RPDC al recrudecer su campana de sancion y presion.
					
					Senala asi el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual de hoy y prosigue: 
					
					Lo problematico es que la medida punitiva recien adoptada por EE.UU. no es simplemente la continuacion de su campana de sancion y presion mantenida hasta la fecha.
					
					Hasta la fecha, ese pais viene justificando sus maniobras dominacionistas sobre la region de Asia-Pacifico so pretexto de la agravacion de la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana. 
					
					Impaciente por el alivio de la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana, se vale ahora de todos los recursos para revertir la corriente de la situacion.
					
					El reciente anuncio de la medida de sancion no es mas que un truco para manchar la imagen exterior de la RPDC y desviar la atencion de la sociedad internacional que aplaude el alivio de la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					En otras palabras, EE.UU. quiere crear de nuevo la coyuntura de enfrentamiento en la Peninsula Coreana al irritar mas fuerte a la RPDC e involucrar el mayor numero de paises en su campana de sancion.
					
					No sera justificada nunca la ilegal y antietica sancion anticoreana.
